body.p: “Birches “,” tree-tops “” and especially slender-twigged willows or osiers are bent over by it “,” as they were not by the snow-white and light frost of yesterday and the day before “,” so that they character or expression of many trees and shrubs is wholly altered. I might not guess what the pollard willow row at Merric’s shore “,” with twigs one or two years old “,” was “,” [image] –instead of [image]
PE 14, pg. 401/ 9 November 1858-7 April 1859 / NNPM MA 1302:34 / T vol. # XXVIII / PDF # XVII / JXI
